titleStmt.title: A rational account of the grounds of Protestant religion being a vindication of the Lord Archbishop of Canterbury's relation of a conference, &c., from the pretended answer by T.C. : wherein the true grounds of faith are cleared and the false discovered, the Church of England vindicated from the imputation of schism, and the most important particular controversies between us and those of the Church of Rome throughly examined / by Edward Stillingfleet ...
titleStmt.author: Stillingfleet, Edward, 1635-1699.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Rob. White for Henry Mortlock ...,

notesStmt.note: An answer to Thomas Carwell's Labyrinthus Cantuariensis.
Conference is between Laud and Fisher. Cf. BM.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
